name: Voice of the Vermin
oracle_text:
Voice of the Vermin enters the battlefield with a shield counter on it. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)
Whenever Voice of the Vermin attacks, target creature you control has base power and toughness 4/4 until end of turn.

name: Undercover Operative
oracle_text: You may have Undercover Operative enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it enters with a shield counter on it if you control that creature. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)

name: "Safe Transit"
oracle_text:
Put a shield counter on target creature. (If that creature would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)

name: "Hammer Bro"
oracle_text:
"Hammer Bro" enters the battlefield with a shield counter on it. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.)
As long as "Hammer Bro" has a shield counter on it, it has trample.

name: Endless Detour
oracle_text: The owner of target spell, nonland permanent, or card in a graveyard puts it on the top or bottom of their library.

name: Meeting of the Five
oracle_text: Exile the top ten cards of your library. You may cast spells with exactly three colors from among them this turn. Add {W}{W}{U}{U}{B}{B}{R}{R}{G}{G}. Spend this mana only to cast spells with exactly three colors.
flavor_text: For years, the five families ruled New Capenna in uneasy peace, and the city prospered.

name: Deal Gone Bad
oracle_text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. Target player mills three cards. (They put the top three cards of their library into their graveyard.)

"Feed the rumor mills with delicious treachery. Bad blood between those two is a good deal for us."
—Kamiz, Obscura Oculus

name: Jetmir's Fixer

flavor_text: When you lose Jetmir's trust, his family makes sure you lose everything else.

name: Slip Out the Back
oracle_text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. It phases out. (Treat it and anything attached to it as though they don't exist until your next turn.)
